scripts.comment: Finch Drama Project - Animation Deck This sketch provides a practical animation interface. For the companion text, please consult the project page: http://personalrobotics.github.io/finchdrama

block.comment: Clear the action library. Careful! This will delete any saved actions.

custom-block.comment: This block will run the driving interface without recording anything. This is useful for trying out different motions. Keys: arrow keys for moving, 1-4 for speed control, X to quit.

scripts.comment: This is the animation recorder. You can enter the name you'd like to give a specific action, perform it using the driving interface, then press X to stop performing and save it.

block.comment: Type the name you'd like to give the action here.

custom-block.s: set value %s for key %s in a-list %l
custom-block.comment: Save the action under the given name.
The playback command can be used like any normal command block to execute a complete action. The action library data is saved along with the sketch.
Fetch a list of the names for all named actions. If you run this, the pop-up will show a list of action names.
Play back the named action from the action library.

block-definition.comment: LABEL will stamp text on the stage at the given font size. The direction of the text is the direction the sprite is facing, and color will match the pen color.

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();

inputs.input: I am known by many names, but you may call me...Tim.

block.l: finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var report = { message: "SPEAK", val: phrase}; chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, report, function() {});

finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var ldir = 0; var rdir = 0; if (left < 0) { ldir = 1; left = -1 * left; } if (right < 0) { rdir = 1; right = -1 * right; } var report = { message: "M".charCodeAt(0), leftdirection: ldir, leftspeed: Math.floor(left * 2.55), rightdirection: rdir, rightspeed: Math.floor(right * 2.55) }; chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, report, function() {});

finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var report = { message:"O".charCodeAt(0), red: Math.floor(rednum*2.55), green: Math.floor(greennum*2.55), blue: Math.floor(bluenum*2.55) }; chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, report, function() {});

finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var fOne = (freq >>> 8) & 0xFF; var fTwo = freq & 0xFF; var tOne = (time >>> 8) & 0xFF; var tTwo = time & 0xFF; var report = { message:"B".charCodeAt(0), timefirst:tOne, timesecond: tTwo, freqfirst:fOne, freqsecond:fTwo }; chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, report, function() {});

finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var fOne = (freq >>> 8) & 0xFF; var fTwo = freq & 0xFF; var tOne = (time >>> 8) & 0xFF; var tTwo = time & 0xFF; var report = { message:"B".charCodeAt(0), timefirst:tOne, timesecond: tTwo, freqfirst:fOne, freqsecond:fTwo }; chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, report, function() {});

var sensorvalue = Number.MAX_VALUE; finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var myself = this; function getSensorData(callback) { var getValue = function(response) { sensorvalue = response.light1; callback(sensorvalue); }; console.log("sending message to chrome"); chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, { message: "POLL" }, getValue); console.log("sent message to chrome"); }; function processValue(sensorvalue) { console.log("sensor value has been set: ", sensorvalue); myself.finchDummy1 = sensorvalue; }; getSensorData(processValue);

var sensorvalue = Number.MAX_VALUE; finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var myself = this; function getSensorData(callback) { var getValue = function(response) { sensorvalue = response.light2; callback(sensorvalue); }; console.log("sending message to chrome"); chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, { message: "POLL" }, getValue); console.log("sent message to chrome"); }; function processValue(sensorvalue) { console.log("sensor value has been set: ", sensorvalue); myself.finchDummy2 = sensorvalue; }; getSensorData(processValue);

var sensorvalue = Number.MAX_VALUE; finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var myself = this; function getSensorData(callback) { var getValue = function(response) { sensorvalue = response.xAcc; callback(sensorvalue); }; console.log("sending message to chrome"); chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, { message: "POLL" }, getValue); console.log("sent message to chrome"); }; function processValue(sensorvalue) { console.log("sensor value has been set: ", sensorvalue); myself.finchDummy3 = sensorvalue; }; getSensorData(processValue);

var sensorvalue = Number.MAX_VALUE; finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var myself = this; function getSensorData(callback) { var getValue = function(response) { sensorvalue = response.yAcc; callback(sensorvalue); }; console.log("sending message to chrome"); chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, { message: "POLL" }, getValue); console.log("sent message to chrome"); }; function processValue(sensorvalue) { console.log("sensor value has been set: ", sensorvalue); myself.finchDummy4 = sensorvalue; }; getSensorData(processValue);

var sensorvalue = Number.MAX_VALUE; finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var myself = this; function getSensorData(callback) { var getValue = function(response) { sensorvalue = response.zAcc; callback(sensorvalue); }; console.log("sending message to chrome"); chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, { message: "POLL" }, getValue); console.log("sent message to chrome"); }; function processValue(sensorvalue) { console.log("sensor value has been set: ", sensorvalue); myself.finchDummy5 = sensorvalue; }; getSensorData(processValue);

var acceleration = Array(3); finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var myself = this; function getSensorData(callback) { var getValue = function(response) { acceleration[0] = response.xAcc; acceleration[1] = response.yAcc; acceleration[2] = response.zAcc; callback(acceleration); }; console.log("sending message to chrome"); chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, { message: "POLL" }, getValue); console.log("sent message to chrome"); }; function processValue(sensorvalue) { var orientation; if(acceleration[0] > -0.5 && acceleration[0] < 0.5 && acceleration[1] < 0.5 && acceleration[1] > -0.5 && acceleration[2] > 0.65 && acceleration[2] < 1.5) orientation = "level"; else if(acceleration[0] > -0.5 && acceleration[0] < 0.5 && acceleration[1] < 0.5 && acceleration[1] > -0.5 && acceleration[2] > -1.5 && acceleration[2] < -0.65) orientation = "upside down"; else if(acceleration[0] < 1.5 && acceleration[0] > 0.8 && acceleration[1] >-0.3 && acceleration[1] < 0.3 && acceleration[2] > -0.3 && acceleration[2] < 0.3) orientation = "beak down"; else if(acceleration[0] < -0.8 && acceleration[0] > -1.5 && acceleration[1] >-0.3 && acceleration[1] < 0.3 && acceleration[2] > -0.3 && acceleration[2] < 0.3) orientation = "beak up"; else if(acceleration[0] > -0.5 && acceleration[0] < 0.5 && acceleration[1] > 0.7 && acceleration[1] < 1.5 && acceleration[2] > -0.5 && acceleration[2] < 0.5) orientation = "left wing down"; else if(acceleration[0] > -0.5 && acceleration[0] < 0.5 && acceleration[1] > -1.5 && acceleration[1] < -0.7 && acceleration[2] > -0.5 && acceleration[2] < 0.5) orientation = "right wing down"; else orientation = "in between"; console.log("sensor value has been set: ", orientation); myself.finchDummy6 = orientation; }; getSensorData(processValue);

var sensorvalue = Number.MAX_VALUE; finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var myself = this; function getSensorData(callback) { var getValue = function(response) { sensorvalue = response.obs1; callback(sensorvalue); }; console.log("sending message to chrome"); chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, { message: "POLL" }, getValue); console.log("sent message to chrome"); }; function processValue(sensorvalue) { var pred = (sensorvalue !== 0); console.log("sensor value has been set: ", pred); myself.finchDummy7 = pred; }; getSensorData(processValue);

var sensorvalue = Number.MAX_VALUE; finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var myself = this; function getSensorData(callback) { var getValue = function(response) { sensorvalue = response.obs2; callback(sensorvalue); }; console.log("sending message to chrome"); chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, { message: "POLL" }, getValue); console.log("sent message to chrome"); }; function processValue(sensorvalue) { var pred = (sensorvalue !== 0); console.log("sensor value has been set: ", pred); myself.finchDummy8 = pred; }; getSensorData(processValue);

var sensorvalue = Number.MAX_VALUE; finchAppID = "ojocioejjpmeccjfjlhkepchminjemod"; var myself = this; function getSensorData(callback) { var getValue = function(response) { sensorvalue = response.temperature; callback(sensorvalue); }; console.log("sending message to chrome"); chrome.runtime.sendMessage(finchAppID, { message: "POLL" }, getValue); console.log("sent message to chrome"); }; function processValue(sensorvalue) { console.log("sensor value has been set: ", sensorvalue); myself.finchDummy9 = sensorvalue; }; getSensorData(processValue);

block-definition.comment: Take any number of input lists, and create a new list containing the items of the input lists. So APPEND [A B] [C D] where the [,,,] are lists reports the list [A B C D] not [[A B] [C D]].
Reports a new list containing the items of the input list, but in the opposite order.
Reports a new list whose items are the same as in the input list, except that if two or more equal items appear in the input list, only the last one is kept in the result.

Reports a sorted version of the list in its first input slot, using the comparison function in the second input slot. For a list of numbers, using < as the comparison function will sort from low to high; using > will sort from high to low.

Send a list of messages (key-value pairs) to a server, returning a list of key-value pairs from the server channel. The list may be empty or null, in which case this polls the server channel without modifying any values. The server descriptor is modified with status (e.g. clock skew) and any other debugging or tracing information.

block.comment: Divide reply by line, drop empty lines, then divide by whitespace. The result is a list of list of values.
Update estimate of difference between local and server clock if the 'updated' value is present in the reply.
Save details of the server transaction to aid in debugging.

block-definition.comment: Create an object holding the properties of a messaging server connection.
Interpret a list of recorded event values encoding various kinds of commands for the Finch robot.

custom-block.s: Finch buzz MIDI note %n for %n beats

block-definition.s: Finch buzz MIDI note %'note' for %'beats' beats
block-definition.comment: Play a note on the Finch buzzer This computes a pitch value in Hertz from a MIDI note value using an equal-temperament scale. For MIDI values, middle C is 60, and the 440Hz reference A is 69.
Parse a file of macro definition text into an association list. Not very robust against syntax errors.
Look up a key in an association list, returning the value if found, else returning a null value (empty report).
Play a named sequence of actions from the given action library. Actions can 'call' other actions, so the procedure is recursive.

Test whether a value is equivalent to an empty report. This a quirk of the type system that this appears to be a number with string length zero. Note that this is different from an empty list, but this value is returned by some list functions to represent 'no list' or 'no value'.

block-definition.s: set value %'value' for key %'key' in a-list %'alist'

custom-block.s: find record for key %s in a-list %l

block-definition.s: find record for key %'key' in a-list %'list'
block-definition.comment: Look up a key in an association list, returning the [key value] list if found, else returning a null value (empty report).

block-definition.s: send cue %'cue' with %'delay' secs delay via server %'server'

block-definition.comment: Query the server channel specified by the server descriptor, returning a list of lists of tokens.

block.comment: Update the duration of the previous command on all but the first iteration.

Insert a move command at the end of the action list with zero duration; this will be corrected on the next change, but handles the case of a final command of indeterminate duration by giving it zero duration.
Update the duration of the previous command on all but the first iteration.

Insert a LED command at the end of the action list with zero duration; this will be corrected on the next change, but handles the case of a final command of indeterminate duration by giving it zero duration.
Update the duration of the previous command on all but the first iteration.

custom-block.s: Finch buzz MIDI note %n for %n beats
Finch buzz MIDI note %n for %n beats

block.comment: Insert a note command at the end of the action list with zero duration; this will be corrected on the next change, but handles the case of a final command of indeterminate duration by giving it zero duration.
